plans

This module exposes functions related to the /plans path.

Source:
  • resources/plans.js, line 1

Methods

(inner) all(opts, body)

GET /plans Makes a request to /plans

Parameters:
Name Type Description
opts Object

An options params which is usually already bound by connect functions.
body Object

The payload for the request. API Reference for this payload

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
count Number <optional>

Pagination option to get a list of plans. Number of plans in a page
page Number <optional>

Pagination option for a list of plans. The page index.
Source:
  • resources/plans.js, line 60

(inner) create(opts, body) → {Promise}

POST /plans Creates a plan from the given payload.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
opts Object

An options params which is usually already bound by connect functions.
body Object

The payload for the request API Reference for this payload
Source:
  • resources/plans.js, line 76
Returns:

Resolves to the result of the request or to an error.

Type
Promise

(inner) find(opts, body)

GET /plans Makes a request to /plans or to /plans/:id

Parameters:
Name Type Description
opts Object

An options params which is usually already bound by connect functions.
body Object

The payload for the request. API Reference for this payload

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
id Number <optional>

The plan's ID. If not sent a plans list will be returned instead.
count Number <optional>

Pagination option to get a list of plans. Number of plans in a page
page Number <optional>

Pagination option for a list of plans. The page index.
Source:
  • resources/plans.js, line 39

(inner) update(opts, body) → {Promise}

PUT /plans/:id Updates a plans from the given payload.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
opts Object

An options params which is usually already bound by connect functions.
body Object

The payload for the request API Reference for this payload

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
id Number

The plan's ID
name String <optional>

The plan's name
trial_days Number <optional>

The number of days to test the plan with no charges
Source:
  • resources/plans.js, line 97
Returns:

A promise that resolves to the newly created plans's data or to an error.

Type
Promise
